hymcmcpy.forward_models package

Submodules

hymcmcpy.forward_models.forward_models module

class hymcmcpy.forward_models.forward_models.ForwardModel(params, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ABC

This abstract class is takes in Params and other arguments to return data-like output. Should not be initialized directly (use an implemented subclass)

Parameters:

  • params (Params) – the parameter that seek to recover using MCMC methods

  • **kwargs (dict) – specific parameters that are unchanging across instatiations

abstract compute()[source]

Generates data-like output given specific parameters.

class hymcmcpy.forward_models.forward_models.PoissonForwardModel(params, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ForwardModel

Forward model for the Poisson distribution, using the rate parameter (lambda) from the Params class.

Parameters:

  • params (Params) – An instance of the Params class, which should contain one entry with the name “lambda” representing the rate parameter for the Poisson distribution.

  • **kwargs – Additional fixed parameters (optional).

Raises:

ValueError – If params does not contain an entry with the name “lambda”.

compute(k)[source]

Compute the Poisson probability mass function (PMF) at a given k.

Parameters:

k (array-like or scalar) – The observed count or counts.

Returns:

The Poisson PMF evaluated at k.

Return type:

float or array-like

Raises:

ValueError – If params does not contain a valid “lambda” entry.
